text: is a city in Toyama Prefecture, Japan. ==History== Takaoka was established in 1609.Crawford, Miki Ward et al. (2010). Japanese War Brides in America: An Oral History, p. 99. It developed as a castle town.Lewis, Michael. (2000). Becoming Apart: National Power and Local Politics in Toyama, 1868-1945, p. 46. The modern city of Takaoka was established in 1889. In 1933, Takaoka's large statue of the Buddha (Daibutsu) was created. ==Geography== ===Surrounding municipalities=== * Toyama Prefecture ** Himi ** Imizu ** Oyabe ** Tonami * Ishikawa Prefecture ** H≈çdatsushimizu ** Tsubata ==Demography== According to Japanese census data,Takaoka population statistics 1995 2000 2005 2010 2015 2020 186,827 185,682 181,229 176,061 172,125 166,393 ==References== ==Other websites== * Official website Category:Cities in Toyama Prefecture
title: Takaoka, Toyama
